N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 815.8 - Toxicology testing

State Regulations
(a) The provider
may administer toxicology tests to a patient to ascertain the use and/or
presence of alcohol and/or other substances, in accordance with program
policies for screening, applicable regulations, clinical judgment, guidance
issued by the Office and mindful of patient dignity. The provider shall inform
a patient of each result and document all results in the patient's record. Supervised collection of a urine toxicology screen may only be conducted by
persons of the same gender, or gender identity, as the patient, based on
patient preference. Toxicology testing may not be used by a provider as a
punitive tool. (b) The provider
must conduct such tests with reliable testing devices and administer such tests
in accordance with manufacturer instructions and in compliance with all

Department of Health requirements. Notes
